page.title: 18Marwell Zoological Park 4.
page.content: The Park is financed chiefly through visitor admission charges since,in contrast to most of the E.E.C.,there is no government support for such establishments.Other sources of finance are an Animal Adoption Scheme, donations and grants from industry and Local Authorities and membership of the Marwell Zoological Society. The Park is advertised over a radius of 30-40 miles -basically the area served by the local I.T.V.transmitter. Visitor numbers are in the order of 220,000 annually,the Park being open all year. A short sample survey of visitors early on a Sunday morning in May 1985 revealed that 56% of the interviewees lived in Hampshire and 22% in adjacent counties. Many had made more than one visit to the Park.
